intro: Barlia patens, commonly known as the yellow crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other related species. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are palmately divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. Barlia patens thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
